sentences.english: Nearly half of all ger dwellers live below the poverty line.
sentences.chinese: 将近一半的蒙古包居民的生活水平处于贫困线以下。

sentences.english: Fuxin Mongolian drama has a unique form of expression and the cultural charm.
sentences.chinese: 阜新蒙古剧有着独特的表现形式和文化魅力。

sentences.english: Mongolian national minority's traditional virtue are many, the father teaches me for the generation toward downloading.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族的传统美德多呀，阿爸教我代代往下传呀。

sentences.english: Mongolia and Russia, based on the use of Cyrillic alphabet text.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古和俄罗斯境内的使用斯拉夫字母为基础的文字。

sentences.english: The white felt yurts of the Mongolian people stand out in the sunshine .
sentences.chinese: 在太阳下，那点点水泡似的蒙古包，闪烁着白光。

sentences.english: Lastly, we designed coding plan of internal code of full information for mongolian information processing system.
sentences.chinese: 最后设计出了蒙古文信息处理全息内部码的编码方案。

sentences.english: The kingdom was conquered by the Mongol and Chinese armies of Kublai Khan .
sentences.chinese: 大理王国后来被忽必烈率领的蒙古族和汉族军队攻破。

sentences.english: China borders on Mongolia to the north.
sentences.chinese: 中国的北方同蒙古接邻。

sentences.english: But he's also raced against a yak (in a sack) in Mongolia…
sentences.chinese: 而他也曾在蒙古套着袋子与一只犁牛赛跑。

sentences.english: Korea to Mongolia only coarse cloth into a wreath.
sentences.chinese: 高丽仅向蒙古进献麤布一次。

sentences.english: This chopstick dance comes from Mongolia.
sentences.chinese: 筷子舞起源于蒙古的舞蹈。

sentences.english: Most tof the inhabitants are Mongolian.
sentences.chinese: 这里的大多数人是蒙古人。

sentences.english: and some native peoples in Mongolia and northern Russia ride reindeer.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古和俄罗斯北部的一些原住民还骑驯鹿。

sentences.english: Coal mine flooding accident occurred in Inner Mongolia Wuhai.
sentences.chinese: 内蒙古乌海发生煤矿透水事故。

sentences.english: Nasonlanbo was a very famous poetess in the history of Mongolian literature in Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 那逊兰保是清代蒙古族文学史上著名的女诗人。

sentences.english: This article has a brief review on Holocene climate changes in Mongolia.
sentences.chinese: 简要地回顾了蒙古全新世气候变化研究。

definition: Mongol
Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Jurchen, a Tungus ethnic group, predecessor of the Manchu ethnic group who founded the Later Jin Dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] and Qing Dynasty
khanate (Mongol state)
Khalkha, largest subgroup of Mongol people
Tatar (person)
Turkic ethnic group
Oirat Mongols (alliance of tribes of Western Mongolia) (Ming Dynasty term)
Han Chinese person or people
Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Temujin, birth name of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2]
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Western Liao, Khitan kingdom of central Asia 1132-1218
